definitions.definition: Having a large physical extent from side to side.
examples: We walked down a wide corridor.
The inquiry had a wide remit.

definitions.definition: Operating at the side of the playing area.
examples: That team needs a decent wide player.

definitions.definition: On one side or the other of the mark; too far sideways from the mark, the wicket, the batsman, etc.
examples: Two balls before lunch, he bowled a wide .
Too bad! That was a great passing-shot, but it's wide .

definitions.definition: Made, as a vowel, with a less tense, and more open and relaxed, condition of the organs in the mouth.
Located some distance away; distant , far .
Far from truth, propriety, necessity, etc.
Of or supporting a greater range of text characters than can fit into the traditional 8-bit representation .

definitions.label_groups: British , slang , only in " wide boy "

main_definition: Having a large physical extent from side to side.
secondary_definitions: ( sports ) Operating at the side of the playing area.
On one side or the other of the mark; too far sideways from the mark, the wicket, the batsman, etc.
( phonetics , dated ) Made, as a vowel, with a less tense, and more open and relaxed, condition of the organs in the mouth.
( Scotland , Northern England , now rare ) Vast , great in extent, extensive .
( obsolete ) Located some distance away; distant , far . [15th–19th c.]
( obsolete ) Far from truth, propriety, necessity, etc.
( computing ) Of or supporting a greater range of text characters than can fit into the traditional 8-bit representation .
( British , slang , only in " wide boy " ) Sharp-witted .
